answers.answer: Hi.On reading your post, the first two things which came to mind straight away, was Thyroid, and Diabetes.Have you had a Thyroid, and a diabetes, along with a full blood count done.I hope this helps.Nicola

Deffinately go and get that checked out! I mean Im only 16 so dont think Im trying to solve your case or anything but heres some ideas?-Hyperthroidism?-Diabeties? (Altough does anyone in your family have it? Or do you have excessive thirst?)Hope this might help.Much Luck to you though.

question: I too have had extreme weight loss - 100 pounds over the last 22 months.  I started out at 285 in October, 2008.   I am 60 years old, female, and a breast cancer survivor (4 years).  I just completed a bone scan, a CT scan of chest/abdomen/pelvis, which showed nothing.  Also, a CT of the brain, which only found a brain was in there (sorry for the gallows humor!) and a sinus infection.  I have a pacemaker.  I quit smoking many years ago (more than 5 or 10.)I'm also dizzy and weak on my feet, sometimes so the point where I fear showering without falling.  I live alone.Any ideas?
title: Extreme weight loss, dizziness, and weakness on feet
